eu.opends.infrastructure

Class Segment

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.opends.infrastructure.Segment

  • public class Segment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a segment of a traffic participant's pathway. Each segment consists of a starting way point, an ending way point, a speed value that the traffic object is trying to reach (by accelerating/braking) on this segment, and a probability value for selecting this segment at the starting way point.
    Author:
    Rafael Math

    • Constructor Detail

      • Segment

        public Segment(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String fromWaypointString,
               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> viaWaypointListString,
               java.lang.String toWaypointString,
               java.lang.String leftNeighborString,
               java.lang.String rightNeighborString,
               float speed,
               boolean isJump,
               float probability,
               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> prioritizedSegments,
               float curveTension)
        Creates a new segment. The segment needs to be initialized with starting way point, ending way point, and a spline before it can be used.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the segment
        fromWaypointString - The string representation of the starting way point
        viaWaypointListString - The string representation of all way points between start and end way point
        toWaypointString - The string representation of the ending way point
        leftNeighborString - The string representation of the neighbor segment to the left
        rightNeighborString - The string representation of the neighbor segment to the right
        speed - The speed of the car
        isJump - Indicates whether the segment will be "jumped" or moved along
        probability - The probability for selecting this segment
        prioritizedSegments - The segments with higher priority than this segment
        curveTension - The curve tension value of the segment (only used if no of way points is greater than 2)

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Returns whether segment has been initialized.
        Returns:
        true, if segment has been initialized.

        public void init(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Waypoint> waypointMap,

                 Simulator sim)
        Initializes a segment: add start way point, end way point, and spline
        Parameters:
        waypointMap - The map of all available way points
        sim - The simulator

        Returns:
        The position on the segment

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getNoOfCurveSegments

        public int getNoOfCurveSegments()
        Returns the number of curve segments (for visualization)
        Returns:
        0 if segment is Linear, 10 if segment is CatmullRom

      • hasViaWaypoints

        public boolean hasViaWaypoints()
        Returns whether the segment has via way points
        Returns:
        true, if the segment has via way points

      • setTraveledDistance

        public void setTraveledDistance(float traveledDistance,
                                TrafficObject trafficObject)
        Setter method for traveled distance of a given traffic object, i.e. the distance (in meters) the traffic object has traveled since the FromWaypoint. This could be used if the segment will be entered by the traffic object somewhere between its FromWaypoint and ToWaypoint.
        Parameters:
        traveledDistance - The distance (in meters) traveled by the traffic object since the FromWaypoint.

      • getTraveledDistance

        public float getTraveledDistance(TrafficObject trafficObject)
        Getter method for traveled distance of a given traffic object, i.e. the distance (in meters) the traffic object has traveled since the FromWaypoint. This could be used if the segment will be entered by the traffic object somewhere between its FromWaypoint and ToWaypoint. After requesting this value, it will be reset to 0.
        Returns:
        The distance (in meters) traveled the traffic object since the FromWaypoint.

      • distance

        public float distance(com.jme3.math.Vector3f position,
                      float minTraveledDistance,
                      float maxTraveledDistance)
        Computes the closest distance from the given position to a point on the segment. Points on the segment to be considered must be located between minTraveledDistance and maxTraveledDistance and have a distance of 1 meter to their neighbors.
        Parameters:
        position - Position to compute distance to the segment
        minTraveledDistance - First point on the segment to be considered
        maxTraveledDistance - Last point on the segment to be considered
        Returns:
        Distance to the closest point on the segment

      • isClear

        public boolean isClear(TrafficObject requestingTrafficObject,
                       float traveledDistance)
        Checks whether the segment is clear of all traffic objects (cars and pedestrians) and the steering car (auto-pilot mode and human-control mode).
        Parameters:
        requestingTrafficObject - Traffic object requesting this information (in order to prevent that own presence will lead to occupied segment)
        traveledDistance - Relative position on the segment (area before and after 30 meters will be inspected only)
        Returns:
        true, if segment is clear of all traffic objects and the steering car in the vicinity of the given position.

      • getViaWPPosition

        public float getViaWPPosition(Waypoint waypoint)
        Computes distance between from way point and given via way point of this segment.
        Parameters:
        waypoint - Via way point
        Returns:
        Distance between from way point and given via way point of this segment. If way point is not a via way point of this segment, 0 will be returned.
